channel.title: Moving a Lodestone
channel.description:
I need help moving my lodestone to the center of Varrock.
[b]Information about lodestones:[/b] Lodestones have 2 objects, the lodestone itself and then the ring that is around the lodestone.
[img]http://puu.sh/8ZrHL.png[/img] [size=1]Image of a lodestone. The ring around the lodestone is 1 object, the center (the thing that looks like a button) is another object.[/size]
[img]http://puu.sh/8ZrXT.png[/img] [size=1]Image of the center of the lodestone.[/size]
[img]http://puu.sh/8Zs0L.png[/img] [size=1]Image of the "ring" of the lodestone.[/size]
[b]What I need help with:[/b] I have managed to get the IDs of both the ring and the "button looking thingy". However, the "ring" uses the object type 22, not the typical 10. I can't really spawn the object, even using object type 22. It never shows as visible, so this is how it looks at the moment:
[img]http://puu.sh/8ZrXT.png[/img] (notice how the "ring" is not showing)
So yeah, how will I move the "ring". I spawn it as object type 22, but nothing comes?
Thanks, Arham

item.title: Moving a Lodestone
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

I need help moving my lodestone to the center of Varrock.

Information about lodestones: Lodestones have 2 objects, the lodestone itself and then the ring that is around the lodestone.


[size=1]Image of a lodestone. The ring around the lodestone is 1 object, the center (the thing that looks like a button) is another object.[/size]


[size=1]Image of the center of the lodestone.[/size]


[size=1]Image of the “ring” of the lodestone.[/size]

What I need help with: I have managed to get the IDs of both the ring and the “button looking thingy”. However, the “ring” uses the object type 22, not the typical 10. I can’t really spawn the object, even using object type 22. It never shows as visible, so this is how it looks at the moment:


(notice how the “ring” is not showing)

So yeah, how will I move the “ring”. I spawn it as object type 22, but nothing comes?

Thanks,
Arham
